Other Information.Additional Info: The diffusion energy barrier for water in UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC pores is lower than in the PA matrix.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion and diffusion energy barriers

Other Information.Additional Info: Sodium sulfate rejection decreases with higher UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC loading due to lower diffusion energy barriers in UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC pores compared to PA matrix.

Guest Molecules.Molecular Size: 18.729 Å x 12.889 Å x 6.137 Å (de-solvated structure)

Other Information.Additional Info: The de-solvated size of Amaranth Red is larger than the effective pore size of the membrane.
Congo Red is rejected by both UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC window pores and PA layer gaps.
Methylene Blue is rejected by both UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC window pores and PA layer gaps.

Sieving Mechanism: Combination of UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC pore channels and PA matrix gaps

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Water flux: 21.09 - 140.14 L·m−2·h−1; Na2SO4 rejection: 95.96% - 18.53%; CR rejection: 97.94%

Other Information.Additional Info: The TFN membranes prepared by dual interfacial polymerization showed four mass transfer pathways: UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC nanochannels, PA free volume, gaps between UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC and PA matrix, and gaps between agglomerated UiO-66-(NH2)2-TMC particles.
